intro: Prunus sativa proles pruna, commonly known as the European blackthorn, is a deciduous shrub native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its dark purple berries and thorny branches. The plant typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters and thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and white, appearing in early spring before the leaves. The berries are used in traditional medicine and as a source of dye.
